org.coniks.coniks_test_client

Class ConsistencyChecks

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.coniks.coniks_test_client.ConsistencyChecks

  • public class ConsistencyChecks
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements all consistency check operations done by a CONIKS client on data received from a CONIKS server. These include data binding proof verification, and non-equivocation checks.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConsistencyChecks() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int verifyMappingProto(C2SProtos.AuthPath authPath, UtilProtos.Commitment comm)
      Verifies that a given mapping is consistent with the server's STR using the proof authPath and the STR comm.
      static int verifyPubKeyProto(ConiksUser user, C2SProtos.AuthPath authPath)
      Tries to retrieve the public key for the given user from disk and checks if the retrieved key is consistent with the public key received in the auth path.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • ConsistencyChecks

        public ConsistencyChecks()

    • Method Detail

      • verifyPubKeyProto

        public static int verifyPubKeyProto(ConiksUser user,
                    C2SProtos.AuthPath authPath)
        Tries to retrieve the public key for the given user from disk and checks if the retrieved key is consistent with the public key received in the auth path.
        Parameters:
        user - the user whose public key to verify
        authPath - the auth path containing the received public key
        Returns:
        whether the check succeeded

      • verifyMappingProto

        public static int verifyMappingProto(C2SProtos.AuthPath authPath,
                     UtilProtos.Commitment comm)
        Verifies that a given mapping is consistent with the server's STR using the proof authPath and the STR comm.
        Returns:
        A ConsistencyErr error code. NO_ERR indicates that the verification passed.
